snippet: GlaxoSmithKline will plead guilty to promoting two drugs for unapproved uses and to failing to report important safety data about a diabetes drug.
abstract: British drugmaker GlaxoSmithKline agrees to plead guilty to criminal charges and pay $3 billion in fines for promoting its best-selling antidepressants for unapproved uses and failing to report safety data about a top diabetes drug; the fine against GlaxoSmithKline over Paxil, Wellbutril, Avandia and other drugs makes this year a record for money recovered by the federal government under its so-called whistle-blower law.

byline.original: By KATIE THOMAS and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

lead_paragraph: GlaxoSmithKline will plead guilty to promoting two drugs for unapproved uses and to failing to report important safety data about a diabetes drug.

headline.seo: GlaxoSmithKline Agrees to Pay $3 Billion in Fraud Settlement
